overview_of_class:
RTVF 368-2 Sec. 20 Diagnostic Scene Study - Th 12:00-2:50 in Louis 106

LEARNING OBJECTIVES: A retrospective critique of curricular and extracurricular performance work in the Acting for Screen module. Course will involve evaluation of performer's range and capabilities in terms of future projects and identity as an actor, as well as a further advanced study of the relationship between the actor and director relative to the camera and an exploration of the film/TV casting process. Course will culminate in a self-edited actor reel for real-world use.

EVALUATION METHOD: Class participation, in-class scene work, out-of-class film projects, compiling of material and reel production
